intro: Synandrodaphne antillana, commonly known as the Caribbean sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the West Indies. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark-colored wood. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces drupes that are typically red or black when mature. Due to its unique properties, it has been historically valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
